name: OciApiGateway
description:
OciApiGateway is the top-level resource representing an OCI API Gateway
 bundled with a single API deployment -- providing managed REST API
 endpoints with routing, authentication, CORS, and rate limiting.

fields.name: CompartmentId
fields.description: OCID of the compartment where the gateway and deployment will be created.

fields.name: EndpointType
fields.description:
Whether the gateway is internet-facing (public) or VCN-internal (private).
 Immutable after creation.

fields.name: SubnetId
fields.description:
OCID of the subnet where the gateway will be deployed.
 For public gateways, this must be a public subnet. Immutable after creation.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: Display name for the gateway. When omitted, the metadata name is used.

fields.name: CertificateId
fields.description:
OCID of the OCI Certificates service certificate for TLS termination
 on the gateway. Only meaningful for public gateways serving HTTPS.

fields.name: NetworkSecurityGroupIds
fields.description: OCIDs of network security groups applied to the gateway.

fields.name: Deployment
fields.description: The API deployment that defines routes, backends, and policies.

fields.name: IsEnabled
fields.description: Whether access logging is enabled.

nestedTypes.name: Authentication
nestedTypes.description:
Authentication configures JWT token validation at the deployment level.
 Tokens are validated before requests reach route backends. This covers
 the most common API security pattern: an IdP (Auth0, OCI IDCS, Okta)
 issues tokens and the gateway validates them via JWKS or static keys.

fields.name: Issuers
fields.description: Token issuers (iss claim). Tokens with issuers not in this list are rejected.

fields.name: Audiences
fields.description: Allowed audiences (aud claim). Tokens not targeting any of these audiences are rejected.

fields.name: TokenHeader
fields.description: HTTP header containing the token. Defaults to "Authorization" on the OCI side.

fields.name: TokenQueryParam
fields.description:
Query parameter containing the token. Mutually exclusive with token_header
 in practice, but OCI allows both (header takes precedence).

fields.name: TokenAuthScheme
fields.description:
Authentication scheme prefix in the header value (e.g., "Bearer").
 Defaults to "Bearer" on the OCI side.

fields.name: MaxClockSkewInSeconds
fields.description: Maximum allowed clock skew in seconds when verifying token exp/nbf/iat claims.

fields.name: IsAnonymousAccessAllowed
fields.description:
When true, unauthenticated requests are allowed through (routes can still
 enforce authorization individually). Useful for APIs with mixed public/private routes.

fields.name: PublicKeys
fields.description: Public key configuration for verifying token signatures.

fields.name: VerifyClaims
fields.description: Additional claims to verify on validated tokens.

nestedTypes.name: Backend
nestedTypes.description: Backend defines where matching requests are forwarded.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Backend type.

fields.name: Url
fields.description:
Target URL for HTTP backends (e.g., "https://backend.example.com:8080").
 Required when type is http.

fields.name: FunctionId
fields.description: OCID of the OCI function to invoke. Required when type is oracle_functions.

fields.name: Status
fields.description:
HTTP status code for stock responses (e.g., 200, 404).
 Only applicable when type is stock_response.

fields.name: Body
fields.description:
Response body for stock responses.
 Only applicable when type is stock_response.

fields.name: ConnectTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Connection timeout in seconds. Applicable to http and oracle_functions backends.

fields.name: ReadTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Read timeout in seconds. Applicable to http and oracle_functions backends.

fields.name: SendTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Send timeout in seconds. Applicable to http and oracle_functions backends.

fields.name: IsSslVerifyDisabled
fields.description:
Whether to skip TLS certificate verification for the backend.
 Applicable to http backends.

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Custom headers to add to requests forwarded to the backend.

nestedTypes.name: BackendHeader
nestedTypes.description: BackendHeader is a custom HTTP header added to backend requests.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Header name.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: Header value.

nestedTypes.name: CorsPolicy
nestedTypes.description: CorsPolicy configures Cross-Origin Resource Sharing for browser-based clients.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description:
Allowed origins. At least one origin is required (e.g., ["*"] or
 ["https://app.example.com"]).

fields.name: AllowedMethods
fields.description: Allowed HTTP methods (e.g., ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE"]).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: Allowed request headers.

fields.name: ExposedHeaders
fields.description: Response headers exposed to the browser.

fields.name: IsAllowCredentialsEnabled
fields.description: Whether the browser may send credentials (cookies, authorization headers).

fields.name: MaxAgeInSeconds
fields.description: How long (in seconds) the browser may cache preflight responses.

nestedTypes.name: Deployment
nestedTypes.description:
Deployment defines the API specification deployed on the gateway.
 Each deployment has a unique path_prefix and contains the route
 definitions, request policies, and logging configuration.

fields.name: PathPrefix
fields.description:
URL path prefix for all routes in this deployment (e.g., "/api/v1").
 Must start with "/" and must be unique per gateway. Immutable after creation.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description:
Display name for the deployment. When omitted, defaults to
 "{gateway_display_name}-deployment".

fields.name: LoggingPolicies
fields.description: Logging configuration for the deployment.

fields.name: RequestPolicies
fields.description: Deployment-level request policies applied before route matching.

fields.name: Routes
fields.description:
API routes defining path-to-backend mappings. At least one route
 is required. Routes are evaluated in order; first match wins.

nestedTypes.name: ExecutionLog
nestedTypes.description: ExecutionLog controls gateway processing detail logging.

fields.name: IsEnabled
fields.description: Whether execution logging is enabled.

fields.name: LogLevel
fields.description: Log verbosity level. Only meaningful when is_enabled is true.

nestedTypes.name: LoggingPolicies
nestedTypes.description:
LoggingPolicies configures access and execution logging for the deployment
 or individual routes.

fields.name: AccessLog
fields.description: Access log captures every request/response pair.

fields.name: ExecutionLog
fields.description: Execution log captures gateway processing details.

nestedTypes.name: PublicKeys
nestedTypes.description: PublicKeys configures how the gateway obtains keys for JWT signature verification.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: How public keys are obtained.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description:
URI of the JWKS endpoint (e.g., "https://idp.example.com/.well-known/jwks.json").
 Required when type is remote_jwks.

fields.name: IsSslVerifyDisabled
fields.description:
Whether to skip TLS certificate verification when fetching JWKS.
 Only applicable when type is remote_jwks.

fields.name: MaxCacheDurationInHours
fields.description:
How long (in hours) to cache the JWKS response. Only applicable when
 type is remote_jwks. OCI defaults to 1 hour.

fields.name: Keys
fields.description: Static keys for token verification. Required when type is static_keys.

nestedTypes.name: RateLimiting
nestedTypes.description: RateLimiting configures request rate limiting at the deployment level.

fields.name: RateInRequestsPerSecond
fields.description: Maximum number of requests per second.

fields.name: RateKey
fields.description: How requests are grouped for rate limiting.

nestedTypes.name: RequestPolicies
nestedTypes.description:
RequestPolicies defines deployment-level policies applied to every request
 before route matching.

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: JWT-based authentication configuration.

fields.name: Cors
fields.description: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing policy for browser-based clients.

fields.name: RateLimiting
fields.description: Rate limiting policy.

nestedTypes.name: Route
nestedTypes.description: Route defines a path-to-backend mapping within the deployment.

fields.name: Path
fields.description:
URL path pattern (e.g., "/users/{userId}", "/health").
 Supports exact, prefix, and wildcard matching per OCI path semantics.

fields.name: Methods
fields.description:
HTTP methods this route handles (e.g., ["GET", "POST"]).
 When empty, all methods are accepted.

fields.name: Backend
fields.description: Backend that processes matching requests.

fields.name: Authorization
fields.description:
Per-route authorization policy. When authentication is configured at
 the deployment level, this controls which routes require valid tokens.

fields.name: LoggingPolicies
fields.description: Per-route logging policy override.

nestedTypes.name: RouteAuthorization
nestedTypes.description:
RouteAuthorization controls access for individual routes when deployment-level
 authentication is enabled.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Authorization enforcement level.

fields.name: AllowedScope
fields.description:
OAuth2 scopes required when type is any_of. The token must contain
 at least one of these scopes.

nestedTypes.name: StaticKey
nestedTypes.description:
StaticKey defines a single public key for JWT signature verification.
 Supports both PEM-encoded certificates and JSON Web Key (JWK) format.

fields.name: Kid
fields.description: Key identifier (kid). Used to match incoming tokens to the correct key.

fields.name: Format
fields.description: Key encoding format.

fields.name: Key
fields.description: PEM-encoded public key or certificate. Required when format is pem.

fields.name: Kty
fields.description: JWK key type (e.g., "RSA", "EC"). Required when format is json_web_key.

fields.name: Alg
fields.description: JWK algorithm (e.g., "RS256"). Used when format is json_web_key.

fields.name: E
fields.description: RSA public exponent (Base64url-encoded). Used for RSA keys in JWK format.

fields.name: N
fields.description: RSA modulus (Base64url-encoded). Used for RSA keys in JWK format.

fields.name: Use
fields.description: JWK public key use (e.g., "sig"). Used when format is json_web_key.

nestedTypes.name: VerifyClaim
nestedTypes.description: VerifyClaim defines an additional claim to verify on validated JWT tokens.

fields.name: Key
fields.description: Claim name (e.g., "scope", "groups", "email").

fields.name: Values
fields.description:
Expected claim values. If non-empty, the token's claim must match
 at least one of these values.

fields.name: IsRequired
fields.description: Whether the claim must be present in the token.
